node.title: Building with Google Maps API #4
node.description:
SHORT VIDEO:   Using apiwithgithub.com to create and fetch the locations API to load markers with their title, location, and content to the map. I wrapped the fetch API in fetchLocations function, make some changes to the previous functions to properly create the markers from the fetched API.

_Repo_
https://github.com/RafaelDavisH/Building-with-Google-Maps-API/tree/part4

_Links_
https://apiwithgithub.com/


_Uses_
EDITOR + TERMINAL
Visual Studio Code - https://code.visualstudio.com/
Visual Studio Code Theme "Cobalt2" by Wes Bos - https://bit.ly/3dXKhfV
Live Sass Compiler - https://bit.ly/2UM7QRD
Fluent Terminal - https://github.com/felixse/FluentTerminal

node.title: Building with Google Maps API #3
node.description:
The goal of this video is to add animations to the markers (DROP and BOUNCE), create an info window with the `InfoWindow()` constructor, and display the title of the Restaurant when hovering over the marker.


_Timestamp_
Start: 01:12
CreateMarkers function: 2:59
infowindow: 3:48

THIS keyword: 8:38

node.title: Build with Google Maps API - #2
node.description:
The goal of this video is to first create one marker to display on the map. Once we have one marker displayed, I'll create an array of objects with multiple restaurant locations, which I'll iterate through each restaurant's latitude and longitude to create a maker for each. Finally, I'll add some styles to the map that I found on the Google Maps API documentation. These styles will give the map a dark mode style.


_Timestamp_
Start with one marker: 1:03
Create multiple locations: 3:22
Refactoring: 5:32
Iterating: 6:40
Styling the map: 8:23

node.title: Building with Google Maps API - #1
node.description:
The goal here is to create the index, stylesheet, and the script file with the main function to get the map loaded on the page. This function requires the use of a constructor provided by Google Maps and two options that must be included in order to properly load the map. These options are center, which requires latitude and longitude, and zoom.

_Timestamp_
Start: 00:40
Getting Google Maps API: 3:10
Request Script: 3:30
Google Cloud Platform: 4:00
InitMap function: 5:45
Getting latitude and longitude coordinates: 7:58
Styling the Map div: 9:50
Adding the API Key: 12:16
